alert.note: Alert for Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Oneida; Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:17PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms approaching northern Lincoln, Vilas, Oneida and northwestern Langlade Counties... At 511 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bessemer to near Fifield to near Ladysmith. Movement was east at 35 mph. The storms should begin to impact western Vilas, Oneida and northwest Lincoln counties by 6 pm and continue to push east across the remainder of these counties through 7:30 pm CDT. These storms are expected to intensify as the evening progresses. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rhinelander, Crandon, Eagle River, Lac Du Flambeau, Tomahawk, Newbold, Harrison, Phelps, Boulder Junction and Woodboro. Those attending anuy outdoor events in this will be in the path of these storms and should prepare for DANGEROUS WEATHER CONDITIONS. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for north central and northeastern Wisconsin.
